013package org.apache.juneau.cp;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ObjectUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ResourceBundleUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
020
021import java.text.*;
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.concurrent.*;
024
025import org.apache.juneau.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.marshaller.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.parser.ParseException;
030import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
031
032/**
033 * An enhanced {@link ResourceBundle}.
034 *
035 * <p>
036 * Wraps a ResourceBundle to provide some useful additional functionality.
037 *
038 * <ul>
039 *    <li>
040 *       Instead of throwing {@link MissingResourceException}, the {@link ResourceBundle#getString(String)} method
041 *       will return <js>"{!key}"</js> if the message could not be found.
042 *    <li>
043 *       Supported hierarchical lookup of resources from parent parent classes.
044 *    <li>
045 *       Support for easy retrieval of localized bundles.
046 *    <li>
047 *       Support for generalized resource bundles (e.g. properties files containing keys for several classes).
048 * </ul>
049 *
050 * <p>
051 * The following example shows the basic usage of this class for retrieving localized messages:
052 *
053 * <p class='bini'>
054 *    <cc># Contents of MyClass.properties</cc>
055 *    <ck>foo</ck> = <cv>foo {0}</cv>
056 *    <ck>MyClass.bar</ck> = <cv>bar {0}</cv>
057 * </p>
058 * <p class='bjava'>
059 *    <jk>public class</jk> MyClass {
060 *       <jk>private static final</jk> Messages <jsf>MESSAGES</jsf> = Messages.<jsm>of</jsm>(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>);
061 *
062 *       <jk>public void</jk> doFoo() {
063 *
064 *       <jc>// A normal property.</jc>
065 *          String <jv>foo</jv> = <jsf>MESSAGES</jsf>.getString(<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"x"</js>);  <jc>// == "foo x"</jc>
066 *
067 *          <jc>// A property prefixed by class name.</jc>
068 *          String <jv>bar</jv> = <jsf>MESSAGES</jsf>.getString(<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"x"</js>);  <jc>// == "bar x"</jc>
069 *
070 *          <jc>// A non-existent property.</jc>
071 *          String <jv>baz</jv> = <jsf>MESSAGES</jsf>.getString(<js>"baz"</js>,<js>"x"</js>);  <jc>// == "{!baz}"</jc>
072 *       }
073 *    }
074 * </p>
075 *
076 * <p>
077 *    The ability to resolve keys prefixed by class name allows you to place all your messages in a single file such
078 *    as a common <js>"Messages.properties"</js> file along with those for other classes.
079 * <p>
080 *    The following shows how to retrieve messages from a common bundle:
081 *
082 * <p class='bjava'>
083 *    <jk>public class</jk> MyClass {
084 *       <jk>private static final</jk> Messages <jsf>MESSAGES</jsf> = Messages.<jsm>of</jsm>(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"Messages"</js>);
085 *    }
086 * </p>
087 *
088 * <p>
089 *    Resource bundles are searched using the following base name patterns:
090 *    <ul>
091 *       <li><js>"{package}.{name}"</js>
092 *       <li><js>"{package}.i18n.{name}"</js>
093 *       <li><js>"{package}.nls.{name}"</js>
094 *       <li><js>"{package}.messages.{name}"</js>
095 *    </ul>
096 *
097 * <p>
098 *    These patterns can be customized using the {@link Builder#baseNames(String...)} method.
099 *
100 * <p>
101 *    Localized messages can be retrieved in the following way:
102 *
103 * <p class='bjava'>
104 *    <jc>// Return value from Japan locale bundle.</jc>
105 *    String <jv>foo</jv> = <jsf>MESSAGES</jsf>.forLocale(Locale.<jsf>JAPAN</jsf>).getString(<js>"foo"</js>);
106 * </p>
107 *
108 * <ul class='seealso'>
109 * </ul>
110 */
111public class Messages extends ResourceBundle {
112
113   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
114   // Static
115   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
116
117   /**
118    * Static creator.
119    *
120    * @param forClass
121    *    The class we're creating this object for.
122    * @return A new builder.
123    */
124   public static final Builder create(Class<?> forClass) {
125      return new Builder(forClass);
126   }
127
128   /**
129    * Constructor.
130    *
131    * @param forClass
132    *    The class we're creating this object for.
133    * @return A new message bundle belonging to the class.
134    */
135   public static final Messages of(Class<?> forClass) {
136      return create(forClass).build();
137   }
138
139   /**
140    * Constructor.
141    *
142    * @param forClass
143    *    The class we're creating this object for.
144    * @param name
145    *    The bundle name (e.g. <js>"Messages"</js>).
146    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, uses the class name.
147    * @return A new message bundle belonging to the class.
148    */
149   public static final Messages of(Class<?> forClass, String name) {
150      return create(forClass).name(name).build();
151   }
152
153   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
154   // Builder
155   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
156
157   /**
158    * Builder class.
159    */
160   @FluentSetters
161   public static class Builder extends BeanBuilder<Messages> {
162
163      Class<?> forClass;
164      Locale locale;
165      String name;
166      Messages parent;
167      List<Tuple2<Class<?>,String>> locations;
168
169      private String[] baseNames = {"{package}.{name}","{package}.i18n.{name}","{package}.nls.{name}","{package}.messages.{name}"};
170
171      /**
172       * Constructor.
173       *
174       * @param forClass The base class.
175       */
176      protected Builder(Class<?> forClass) {
177         super(Messages.class, BeanStore.INSTANCE);
178         this.forClass = forClass;
179         this.name = forClass.getSimpleName();
180         locations = list();
181         locale = Locale.getDefault();
182      }
183
184      @Override /* BeanBuilder */
185      protected Messages buildDefault() {
186
187         if (! locations.isEmpty()) {
188            Tuple2<Class<?>,String>[] mbl = locations.toArray(new Tuple2[0]);
189
190            Builder x = null;
191
192            for (int i = mbl.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
193               Class<?> c = firstNonNull(mbl[i].getA(), forClass);
194               String value = mbl[i].getB();
195               if (isJsonObject(value, true)) {
196                  MessagesString ms;
197                  try {
198                     ms = Json5.DEFAULT.read(value, MessagesString.class);
199                  } catch (ParseException e) {
200                     throw asRuntimeException(e);
201                  }
202                  x = Messages.create(c).name(ms.name).baseNames(split(ms.baseNames, ',')).locale(ms.locale).parent(x == null ? null : x.build());
203               } else {
204                  x = Messages.create(c).name(value).parent(x == null ? null : x.build());
205               }
206            }
207
208            return x == null ? null : x.build();  // Shouldn't be null.
209         }
210
211         return new Messages(this);
212      }
213
214      private static class MessagesString {
215         public String name;
216         public String[] baseNames;
217         public String locale;
218      }
219
220      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
221      // Properties
222      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
223
224      /**
225       * Adds a parent bundle.
226       *
227       * @param parent The parent bundle.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
228       * @return This object.
229       */
230      public Builder parent(Messages parent) {
231         this.parent = parent;
232         return this;
233      }
234
235      /**
236       * Specifies the bundle name (e.g. <js>"Messages"</js>).
237       *
238       * @param name
239       *    The bundle name.
240       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the forClass class name is used.
241       * @return This object.
242       */
243      public Builder name(String name) {
244         this.name = isEmpty(name) ? forClass.getSimpleName() : name;
245         return this;
246      }
247
248      /**
249       * Specifies the base name patterns to use for finding the resource bundle.
250       *
251       * @param baseNames
252       *    The bundle base names.
253       *    <br>The default is the following:
254       *    <ul>
255       *       <li><js>"{package}.{name}"</js>
256       *       <li><js>"{package}.i18n.{name}"</js>
257       *       <li><js>"{package}.nls.{name}"</js>
258       *       <li><js>"{package}.messages.{name}"</js>
259       *    </ul>
260       * @return This object.
261       */
262      public Builder baseNames(String...baseNames) {
263         this.baseNames = baseNames == null ? new String[]{} : baseNames;
264         return this;
265      }
266
267      /**
268       * Specifies the locale.
269       *
270       * @param locale
271       *    The locale.
272       *    If <jk>null</jk>, the default locale is used.
273       * @return This object.
274       */
275      public Builder locale(Locale locale) {
276         this.locale = locale == null ? Locale.getDefault() : locale;
277         return this;
278      }
279
280      /**
281       * Specifies the locale.
282       *
283       * @param locale
284       *    The locale.
285       *    If <jk>null</jk>, the default locale is used.
286       * @return This object.
287       */
288      public Builder locale(String locale) {
289         return locale(locale == null ? null : Locale.forLanguageTag(locale));
290      }
291
292      /**
293       * Specifies a location of where to look for messages.
294       *
295       * @param baseClass The base class.
296       * @param bundlePath The bundle path.
297       * @return This object.
298       */
299      public Builder location(Class<?> baseClass, String bundlePath) {
300         this.locations.add(0, Tuple2.of(baseClass, bundlePath));
301         return this;
302      }
303
304      /**
305       * Specifies a location of where to look for messages.
306       *
307       * @param bundlePath The bundle path.
308       * @return This object.
309       */
310      public Builder location(String bundlePath) {
311         this.locations.add(0, Tuple2.of(forClass, bundlePath));
312         return this;
313      }
314
315      // <FluentSetters>
316
317      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
318      public Builder impl(Object value) {
319         super.impl(value);
320         return this;
321      }
322
323      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
324      public Builder type(Class<?> value) {
325         super.type(value);
326         return this;
327      }
328
329      // </FluentSetters>
330
331      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
332      // Other methods
333      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
334
335      ResourceBundle getBundle() {
336         ClassLoader cl = forClass.getClassLoader();
337         JsonMap m = JsonMap.of("name", name, "package", forClass.getPackage().getName());
338         for (String bn : baseNames) {
339            bn = StringUtils.replaceVars(bn, m);
340            ResourceBundle rb = findBundle(bn, locale, cl);
341            if (rb != null)
342               return rb;
343         }
344         return null;
345      }
346   }
347
348   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
349   // Instance
350   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
351
352   private ResourceBundle rb;
353   private Class<?> c;
354   private Messages parent;
355   private Locale locale;
356
357   // Cache of message bundles per locale.
358   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Locale,Messages> localizedMessages = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
359
360   // Cache of virtual keys to actual keys.
361   private final Map<String,String> keyMap;
362
363   private final Set<String> rbKeys;
364
365
366   /**
367    * Constructor.
368    *
369    * @param builder
370    *    The builder for this object.
371    */
372   protected Messages(Builder builder) {
373      this(builder.forClass, builder.getBundle(), builder.locale, builder.parent);
374   }
375
376   Messages(Class<?> forClass, ResourceBundle rb, Locale locale, Messages parent) {
377      this.c = forClass;
378      this.rb = rb;
379      this.parent = parent;
380      if (parent != null)
381         setParent(parent);
382      this.locale = locale == null ? Locale.getDefault() : locale;
383
384      Map<String,String> keyMap = new TreeMap<>();
385
386      String cn = c.getSimpleName() + '.';
387      if (rb != null) {
388         rb.keySet().forEach(x -> {
389            keyMap.put(x, x);
390            if (x.startsWith(cn)) {
391               String shortKey = x.substring(cn.length());
392               keyMap.put(shortKey, x);
393            }
394         });
395      }
396      if (parent != null) {
397         parent.keySet().forEach(x -> {
398            keyMap.put(x, x);
399            if (x.startsWith(cn)) {
400               String shortKey = x.substring(cn.length());
401               keyMap.put(shortKey, x);
402            }
403         });
404      }
405
406      this.keyMap = unmodifiable(copyOf(keyMap));
407      this.rbKeys = rb == null ? Collections.emptySet() : rb.keySet();
408   }
409
410   /**
411    * Returns this message bundle for the specified locale.
412    *
413    * @param locale The locale to get the messages for.
414    * @return A new {@link Messages} object.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
415    */
416   public Messages forLocale(Locale locale) {
417      if (locale == null)
418         locale = Locale.getDefault();
419      if (this.locale.equals(locale))
420         return this;
421      Messages mb = localizedMessages.get(locale);
422      if (mb == null) {
423         Messages parent = this.parent == null ? null : this.parent.forLocale(locale);
424         ResourceBundle rb = this.rb == null ? null : findBundle(this.rb.getBaseBundleName(), locale, c.getClassLoader());
425         mb = new Messages(c, rb, locale, parent);
426         localizedMessages.put(locale, mb);
427      }
428      return mb;
429   }
430
431   /**
432    * Returns all keys in this resource bundle with the specified prefix.
433    *
434    * <p>
435    * Keys are returned in alphabetical order.
436    *
437    * @param prefix The prefix.
438    * @return The set of all keys in the resource bundle with the prefix.
439    */
440   public Set<String> keySet(String prefix) {
441      Set<String> set = set();
442      keySet().forEach(x -> {
443         if (x.equals(prefix) || (x.startsWith(prefix) && x.charAt(prefix.length()) == '.'))
444            set.add(x);
445      });
446      return set;
447   }
448
449   /**
450    * Similar to {@link ResourceBundle#getString(String)} except allows you to pass in {@link MessageFormat} objects.
451    *
452    * @param key The resource bundle key.
453    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
454    * @return
455    *    The resolved value.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
456    *    <js>"{!key}"</js> if the key is missing.
457    */
458   public String getString(String key, Object...args) {
459      String s = getString(key);
460      if (s.startsWith("{!"))
461         return s;
462      return format(s, args);
463   }
464
465   /**
466    * Looks for all the specified keys in the resource bundle and returns the first value that exists.
467    *
468    * @param keys The list of possible keys.
469    * @return The resolved value, or <jk>null</jk> if no value is found or the resource bundle is missing.
470    */
471   public String findFirstString(String...keys) {
472      for (String k : keys) {
473         if (containsKey(k))
474            return getString(k);
475      }
476      return null;
477   }
478
479   @Override /* ResourceBundle */
480   protected Object handleGetObject(String key) {
481      String k = keyMap.get(key);
482      if (k == null)
483         return "{!" + key + "}";
484      try {
485         if (rbKeys.contains(k))
486            return rb.getObject(k);
487      } catch (MissingResourceException e) { /* Shouldn't happen */ }
488      return parent.handleGetObject(key);
489   }
490
491   @Override /* ResourceBundle */
492   public boolean containsKey(String key) {
493      return keyMap.containsKey(key);
494   }
495
496   @Override /* ResourceBundle */
497   public Set<String> keySet() {
498      return keyMap.keySet();
499   }
500
501   @Override /* ResourceBundle */
502   public Enumeration<String> getKeys() {
503      return Collections.enumeration(keySet());
504   }
505
506   @Override /* Object */
507   public String toString() {
508      JsonMap m = new JsonMap();
509      for (String k : new TreeSet<>(keySet()))
510         m.put(k, getString(k));
511      return Json5.of(m);
512   }
513}
